intro: Spermacoce occidentalis, commonly known as the western starburry, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, white to pink flowers that are clustered in umbels, giving it a star-like appearance. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
